%text \textbf{Basic Identities} The following trigonometric identities are fundamental We are not giving proofs for them here. But you should \underline\text{commit these to memory } % \begin{align}
\sin (A+B) &= \sin A\cdot \cos B + \cos A\cdot \sin B \\ \sin (A-B) &= \sin A\cdot \cos B - \cos A\cdot \sin B \\ \cos (A + B) &= \cos A \cdot \cos B - \sin A\cdot \sin B \\ \cos (A-B) &= \cos A\cdot \cos B + \sin A\cdot \sin B \\ \tan (A+B) &= \dfrac{\tan A + \tan B}{1-\tan A\cdot \tan B} \\ \tan (A-B) &= \dfrac{\tan A - \tan B}{1+ \tan A\cdot \tan B} \end{align} %text %
